Grain.Do: Cooked whole grains like quinoa (1 cup cooked), amaranth (1 cup cooked), basmati rice (1 cup cooked). Warm, cooked grains are best for Vata. Consider oats cooked with water or almond milk (1/2 cup dry).
Grain.Dont: Dry, light, or cold grains like crackers, popcorn, or raw oats. Avoid excessive amounts of wheat if it increases Kapha.

Legume.Do: Well-cooked and spiced lentils like moong dal (1/2 cup cooked) or masoor dal (1/2 cup cooked). Soaked and sprouted lentils are easier to digest.
Legume.Dont: Heavy beans like kidney beans or black beans unless thoroughly cooked and spiced. Avoid raw sprouts.

Veg.Do: Cooked, grounding vegetables like sweet potatoes (1/2 cup mashed), pumpkin (1/2 cup cooked), carrots (1/2 cup cooked), zucchini (1 cup cooked). Warm, steamed, or roasted vegetables are preferred.
Veg.Dont: Raw, bitter, or astringent vegetables like raw salads, bitter gourd, or cauliflower. Avoid cruciferous vegetables in large raw amounts.

Spices.Do: Warming and digestive spices like ginger (1/2 tsp grated, fresh), cumin (1/2 tsp), coriander (1/2 tsp), cardamom (1/4 tsp), black pepper (pinch, if tolerated). Fenugreek for blood sugar and blood pressure support.
Spices.Dont: Excessive amounts of chili, strong pungent spices, or very dry spices.

Leafy veg.Do: Cooked leafy greens like spinach (1 cup cooked), kale (1 cup cooked), or swiss chard (1 cup cooked). Lightly sautéed or steamed.
Leafy veg.Dont: Raw leafy greens in large quantities, especially bitter ones.

Oil.Do: Nourishing oils like ghee (1-2 tsp), sesame oil (1 tsp, warmed), or almond oil (1 tsp). Use sparingly for cooking.
Oil.Dont: Excessive amounts of cold or processed oils. Avoid hydrogenated oils.

Fruits.Do: Sweet, ripe, and juicy fruits like ripe bananas (1/2), cooked apples or pears (1 medium, stewed), berries (1/2 cup). Best eaten alone or between meals.
Fruits.Dont: Astringent or unripe fruits like unripe apples, cranberries, or pomegranate. Avoid eating fruits with meals.

Nuts and Dry fruits.Do: Soaked almonds (5-8, peeled), walnuts (2-3 pieces), or soaked and peeled sunflower seeds (1 tbsp). Beneficial for Vata but should be consumed in moderation.
Nuts and Dry fruits.Dont: Dry roasted nuts, large quantities of nuts, or nuts that are difficult to digest.

Milk product.Do: Warm, full-fat milk (1 cup, preferably organic) with warming spices like cardamom or ginger. Yogurt (1/4 cup, well-fermented and not too sour) with meals for digestion.
Milk product.Dont: Cold milk, sour yogurt, or hard cheeses. Limit or avoid processed dairy.

Non-veg.Do: Light and easy-to-digest cooked non-vegetarian options like steamed fish (3-4 oz), chicken soup (1 cup), or well-cooked eggs (1-2). Consider quality sources.
Non-veg.Dont: Heavy, fried, or processed meats. Red meat in large quantities can be difficult for Vata to digest and may exacerbate hypertension. Avoid cold preparations.

Condiments.Do: Mild chutneys (e.g., date or tamarind, 1 tbsp), fresh ginger paste (1/4 tsp). Use salt in moderation due to hypertension.
Condiments.Dont: Spicy, sour, or extremely pungent condiments. Avoid pickles and heavily salted items.
